Chile: Pedro de Valdivia founds Santiago de Nueva Extremadura, now known as Santiago.
es:Lucas Martínez Vegaso founds Villa San Marcos de Arica, now known as Arica.

An uprising led by toqui Michimalonco attacks fledgling Santiago in an attempt to drive out the Spanish. Key actions undertaken by Inés de Suárez, the first Spanish woman to set foot in Chile, are attributed with avoiding the complete destruction of the outnumbered settlement.
